abstract.p: Susan Malloy letter on Marshall Sella's and Ian Fisher's May 21 article holds CBS should put video surveillance equipment in Burundi refugee camps so that Americans can witness real human drama

block.p: CBS should put video surveillance equipment in a ''regroupment camp'' in Burundi. This way Americans could see real human drama, an authentic struggle for survival. How will a group of 300,000 strangers get along when they're packed together in rickety thatched shacks? Who will eat today? Whose child will die of fever? After a few months of this cutting-edge television, Africa might cease to be such an ''impenetrable, illogical mystery'' (The Way We Live Now: ''A Continent's Chaos'' by Jeffrey Goldberg) to us. We might even find the will to fund adequate foreign-aid programs.
